Blog.post: Ever wondered what a urlLink Bad head, or a head crash on a hard drive might sound like well wonder no more. Hitachi has your back, on their support page they have a variety of sounds of HDs crashing and burning so to speak. Check it out, I'm so going to use this when i'm doing tech support.

Seems the wonderful corporate artists at etoy has started an urlLink etoy.DAY-CARE , it's goals are: etoy.DAY-CARE was established in 2001 to reach the following corporate goals: -to recruit and train outstanding individuals for long term etoy.OPERATIONS -to research identity issues, group behavior patterns and the creativity potential of children in digital environments to integrate children into the production of art instead of teaching them about art -to study future markets and to give etoy a competitive edge -to test and improve etoy.ART in a playful and innocent environment Why can't i be 10 again! Seems very cool i'd totally forgottten about etoy. Reminded me i've also lost track of urlLink RTMark , i wonder how they are holding up.

A gentleman spends the better part of his life documenting his life, how much does it cost him to make the video $218 roughly, yet when he investigates the cost of the music that he wants to license in the video the price sky rockets to urlLink $400,000 . Though i must admit when i read stories like this i have to ask where did he get his camera and tape from? Also how did he edit this masterpiece? Last time i checked even a cheap Camera ran about $200 for an extremely low end. You easily run into the $500 range without batting an eye. And tape even in bulk isn't cheap. What ticks me off is the ratio, not the exact amounts.

For me i don't have as much free time as i would like to. I don't have time to create like i used to. I haven't yet purchased from urlLink these guys , there price is sorta steep, starting at $299 for a set, or $99 for a clip. Their samples look quite beautiful, especially as an alpha channel overlay would add character to just about any video i think.

What a better way to christen Media Wh0re. Then to link to a mpeg of a urlLink Tornado sucks up entire house . Interesting side note is tapes and pictures of storms and tornadoes were what got me into media, both still and motion.

Ok. So maybe i'm not enough a programmer/developer to understand this, but i have to rant. WHY OH WHY, do vendors make "simulators" for their hardware products in Java, only to have them only run in windows?!? They go on and on and on how it's java based and the silulator is written in java as well, shouldn't that mean it can be recompiled for Linux, Mac, etc?! Argh

I must say i truly love my sidekick. The software is well integrated and the device is a decent size. The problem is i've been unhappy with the way urlLink T-Mobile has been handling the device and it's service specific to it. There has been a decent amount of hub-bub around urlLink Danger's newest incarnation of the device, but no really good pics of it, until urlLink now at least. Though i must say i'm noot sure what i'll do when it's time to replace my sidekick, if i'll upgrade to the newest hiptop, or something else. I do know one thing, i am not a fan of the urlLink Treo 600 , like everyone else seems to be. Perhaps i'll look into a urlLink blackberry and get a separate cell phone for voice. I'd been considering that with my Hiptop for quite sometime now, just can't justify it since i rarely use the phone aspect of it. Anyone have any suggestions i'd love to hear them.

Well I'm certainly behind on the news. Apparently urlLink SubEthaEdit V2.0 was release a couple days ago, I didn't even realize it. Also looks like they added all the improvements i wanted into it: code completion, line numbering always on, and new window size setting. In case you don't know the coolest feature of SubEthaEdit is the fact that it allows writers(code, document, etc) to collaborate together using rendezvous. I'm very much stoked. So rush out and get it. Oh best part is it's free.

I don't have a PocketPC but i keep getting twinges to buy one simply from my gadget addiction kicking in. That and the fact i don't have one and never used one for extended ammount of time so i can't realize i'd use it as much as my half a dozen Palm Pilots i have laying about. Then i discover apps like, urlLink WiFiFoFum , which kicks my gadget addiction, specifically the PocketPC vein into high gear.
Hopefully the craziness over the iPod Mini will finally subside with news of urlLink this coming out.

This urlLink blog entry is a perfect example of why i blog and why i feel blogging is important. It's not about "stating" something as fact. It's about posting commentary on the world around us and quite often asking for feedback from the community. I know in past blogs i've ran i've asked questions as many times as i've posted pure commentary. I think it's just a new idea in media, and it will take time for people to understand exactly WHY it's different the past forms.

I must say, as a gamer and gadget freak, i'm very saddened by the lack of "cool stuff" that America has compared to all the amazingly cool (and mostly useless) stuff Japan has. I mean i can finally get urlLink a Hello Kitty memory card for the PS2 , urlLink Metal Gear Gamecube Bundle Pack . It's all only via import. Come on guys get with it and bring us cool limited editions. Americans are RIPE for the what seems like the Japanese tradition of owning multiple copies of consoles. I mean if they brought that gamecube to the US i'd definitely buy a second one. I'd soo buy a urlLink FFXI special edition PS2. Oh well i just have to be patient and vote w/ my money when i can.

The new version of playfair, urlLink hymn -- Hear Your Music aNywhere which cracks the DRM on tunes purchased from iTunes, but doesn't strip your Unique ID from the file. I feel this is the best anti DRM software yet. DRM is a touchy subject and it's still in the process of finding the "right path". So having tools like this is handy in case said DRM style becomes antiquated. Though in the end you are still breaking the licensing agreement/law.

I don't want one, I NEED urlLink one . No seriously, please i'm a sucker for old school film tech. I have an old school 8MM and i'd have probably half a dozen or more if i still went to yard sales and flea markets like i used to when i was a kid. Ok this is quite old but supposedly people have urlLink the real dirt on Apple’s Cinema Displays? While the sizes seem about right as well as the resolutions there are a couple of things that common sense just state don't work. First of all, switching from the ADC(Apple Display Connector) to DVI. I think Apple really likes be slick and having as few wires as possible. With dropping ADC you lose Video, Power and USB all in one cable. So you would go from 1 cable to 3 cables. Which brings me to my next point, they state there will be 2 firewire ports on it. How is this possible since ADC doesn't carry firewire signal and if they do go with DVI there would be neither USB or Firewire. So now that's 4 wires coming out of this display. Bleh i wouldn't mind many of these features but just don't see it happening.

Sadly right before my switch over, i as well suffered from the delussion that I could urlLink turn my PC into a Mac . As the expression goes the interface is just skin deep. You don't get the true OS X experience. Well perhaps you can now, as when i did this it was 3 years ago, and the software on the market to do these things was new and buggy. Still interesting to see, i wonder what the psychological aspects of all this are. Perhaps there aren't any haha.

I have dreams about having an army of robotic artist minions to do my bidding as an artist. For i seem to think on a more conceptual level and not really good at that whole "creating" bit. I can think of cool idea but horrible at making content. Just all about remixing and re-manifesting previous art into my new pieces and now i almost can have my dream with, urlLink Project K . So just need more machines making abstract automatic art, preferably which changes over time so that i can incorporate them into my video. Mmmmm robotic artists...

It's days like today that i'm still amazed by Apple Computers. There is all this press about a few pictures of a "new"/"upgraded" g5 that have been leaked, or photoshoped. Whatever the case may be. Then they release the urlLink AirPort Express . I think several times more amazing then an upgraded G5 will ever be. I mean i'm looking forward to a bump since i'm in the market for a urlLink mid range g5 and urlLink mid range screen . The fact that they made a complete base station alittle larger then there current powerbricks AND added urlLink features to it, just blows me away. Keep it up Apple and keep me amazed.

So i was just thinking about sharing tunes via urlLink rendezvous and wireless networks . When i realized well i only carry my tunes via my iPod making it useless in this system, then i was like why can't i hook it up to the USB port on the Pocket PC. Nope, USB is a Master/Slave relationship not Peer-to-Peer like Firewire. Luckily urlLink a USB host Compact Flash card is soon to be released. Then i realized between USB 1.1 speed, the speed of wireless, and PocketPC speed, this would be gawd awful slow, i still think it would be worthwhile to tinker around with. I guess i'll still look forward to a company to actually incorporate this sort of sharing into the Mp3 Player of choice for me.
